question: I'm new here and hope I'm doing this correctly.  I'm hoping someone has some answers as my family and I are at wits end.My father has had Parkinson's for a little over a decade.  Most of his symptoms have been maintained through medication.  He also has diabetes and much to my chagrin refuses to change his diet to help that situation out.In mid April he had lumbar fusion surgery and while the surgery itself was successful, the aftermath has been nothing short of h-e-double hockey sticks.  Shortly after he developed a paranoia that prevented him from sleeping. He couldn't get comfortable in any position, horizontal or vertical.  The sleep deprivation began to affect his mind and he started making no sense.  His doctors tried a multitude of different medications to try and get him some rest but none were successful.  Recently, due to a multitude of complaints from him, his orthopedic surgeon did a nerve conduction (I think that's what it's called) test and found a pinched nerve in each leg.  He received a cortisone shot in each leg and it seems to have helped but not completely alleviated the pain.  Now he is basically unable to walk, has just become an invalid and just sits in a chair and has everyone do everything for him.  He has moments of clarity and is fine and then others his mind seems to not connect.Throughout all of this his neurologist has been changing his park. meds and I know that can be a lengthy process.  We just don't know where to go and what to do. He is 70 years old so I don't expect him to be doing backflips but to have back surgery and have his mind affected so severely just doesn't seem right.  Does anyone have any idea on where to turn?  His GP seems to be of no help, his neurologist is aware of the situation but doesn't seem to be doing much.  Just incredibly frustrated and confused.
title: Not sure where to turn...
